page.title: 18KEW GARDENS
page.content: In 1728 a house in Kew was rented to Frederick, Prince of Wales, whose wife Princess Augusta decided to replan the gardens and remodel the house. She enlarged the gardens and comissioned William Chambers to design a {Pagoda} and an{Orangery}to ornament them.{Kew} {Palace }was later incorporated into the grounds.The foundation date of the gardens is accepted as 1759, since then plants have been collected from all over the world and 14 houses such as the{Palm House}and{Temperate House have been built to accomodate them. Other attractions at Kew are the {Waterlily House}where the giant waterlily Victoria Amazonica can be seen, the{flagpole}made from Douglas Fir is over 33 metres high, the{wood} {museum,}the vast new {Alpine House } which should be completed this year and many others.
